intro: Setouratea, commonly known as the blueberry fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage and small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white. The plant is native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in tropical and subtropical climates. Setouratea species typically thrive in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to shady garden landscapes.
